results.deck: A Shonen Jump mash-up fighting game with a gritty, realistic aesthetic, and real-world locations.
results.description:
Overview

In celebration of the 50th anniversary of the popular Japanese magazine Weekly Shounen Jump, Jump Force is being developed by Spike Chunsoft and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment with a targeted release date in February 2019. The game will feature a large crossover of popular characters from various Shounen Jump manga, along with a handful of original characters designed by Akira Toriyama, creator of the Dragon Ball franchise.

Plot

A mysterious figure has merged the various worlds of Shounen Jump into the "real" world as we know it. A man named Director Glover, with the help of his trusty Navigator, forms the J-Force to uncover the source behind this incident and restore everyone to their correct world.

Characters

44 characters from from 16 different series are available to play as, aswell as 2 more original Jump Force characters.

results.deck: A video game adaptation of the Kill la Kill anime developed by Arc System Works and Aplus in association with Studio Trigger.
results.description:
A 3D fighting game heavily supervised by the original creators from Studio Trigger. Kill la Kill - If offers both the chance to recreate fight scenes from the anime and a story mode that takes an alternate path.

Characters

The following characters are confirmed playable:

  • Ryuko Matoi: the tomboyish wielder of the giant Scissor Blade, she transfers into Honnouji Academy to find the missing half, and possibly her father's murderer with it.
  • Satsuki Kiryuin: the Student Council President of Honnouji who rules over the academy with an iron fist. She wields the Bakuzan blade.
  • Ira Gamagoori: One of the Elite Four, a hulking brute and total masochist who maintains discipline over the student body.
  • Uzu Sanageyama: One of the Elite Four, a kendo master who oversees the athletic clubs at the academy.
  • Houka Inumuta: One of the Elite Four, a master hacker and treasurer of the student council who uses his technology to quickly attack his enemies' weak points.
  • Nonon Jakuzure: One of the Elite Four, the conductor of the Academy's marching band who oversees the non-athletic student clubs.
  • Nui Harime: The Grand Couturier of REVOCS who murdered Ryuko's father and took one half of the Scissor Blade, but not before losing an eye to its other half.
  • Ragyo Kiryuin: Satsuki's mother, President of Honnouji, and the CEO of REVOCS. Her true goals are a mystery.
  • Ryuko Matoi (Dual-Wield): After taking the other half of the Scissor Blade from Nui, Ryuko has merged even further with Senketsu and transformed herself into an even more ferocious fighter.
  • Satsuki Kiryuin (Dual-Wield): Merging herself fully with Junketsu's power, Satsuki wields both the Bakuzan Kōryu and Bakuzan Gako to cut down her enemies.
  • [DLC] Mako Mankanshoku: Ryuko's first real friend at Honnouji and a total airhead. She comes into battle after being granted a special kamui that lets her go toe-to-toe with Ryuko.
  • [DLC] Ultimate Double Naked DTR: Final form of Nudist Beach's special anti-kamui mecha, a fusion of both Aikuro Mikisugi's and Tsumugu Kinagase's DTRs.
results.name: Kill la Kill - If

results.deck: An adventure game set in a futuristic Tokyo about a detective trying to solve a series of murders where all of the victims are discovered with their left eye missing.
results.description:
Overview

AI: The Somnium Files is a sci-fi adventure game with a branching narrative where the player controls a detective named Kaname Date who is investigating a series of murders in Tokyo where all of the victims have had their left eye removed. Throughout the game the player can enter the dreams of suspects through the use of Date's cybernetic abilities where they can solve puzzles to reveal new information related to the case. AI is being developed by Spike Chunsoft with Kotaro Uchikoshi, creator of the Zero Escape Series, serving as the title's writer and director. The game is planned to be released worldwide for the PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, and PC on September 17, 2019.

results.deck: An adult visual novel developed by Leaf about a high school student investigating why one of his fellow students seemingly went mad during his class. The game is notable for coining the term "visual novel".
results.description:
Overview

Shizuku (雫) is an adult horror game published by Leaf for the NEC PC-98 on January 26, 1996. The title is about a morbid high school student that is asked by his uncle, who is a teacher, to investigate why one of the popular girls at his school suddenly went mad during class and clawed her own face, leading to him unearthing a much larger mystery. While the game is very similar to Chunsoft's sound novel titles in terms of presentation and structure, Shizuku was instead branded by Leaf as the first entry in a series called the Leaf Visual Novel Series (LVNS). This was the game that coined the term "visual novel" that is popularly used today to classify Japanese novel games and was a major influence on many early titles in the genre.

Shizuku was eventually remade in 2004 for Windows computers under the name Shizuku Renewal which featured redrawn artwork, a new soundtrack and rewrites made to the story in order for the game to be in compliance with new rules made by the Ethics Organization of Computer Software.

Trivia

  • Upper management at Leaf basically allowed the development team for Shizuku to create whatever they wanted but with a few stipulations. The game had to be set in a high school, the protagonist had to be a boy and they infamously required that the player must be able to reach the first sex scene within 5 minutes of starting the game. This was made achievable by having a bad ending near the beginning of the story that can be obtained if the player refuses to investigate the mysteries surrounding the school.
  • While Shizuku coined the word "visual novel" the game is also responsible for popularizing the term "True End". Other games with multiple endings had previously called their canonical ending the "happy ending" or something similar. Shizuku was the first game to classify its story's real conclusion as the "true" ending, which would become a common term within the visual novel genre.

External Links

  1. Bungle Bungle - The official website of Tatsuya Takahashi and Tooru Minazuki, creators of the Leaf Visual Novel Series.
results.name: Shizuku

results.deck: A sci-fi adventure game about the creation of a nuclear bomb shelter meant to save humanity from the inevitable nuclear war. The title was the first entry in Systam Sacom's Novel Ware series and was based off a book written by Shizuko Natsuki.
results.description:
Overview

Dome is a sci-fi adventure game based off the book "Dome: Prelude to the End" written by Shizuko Natsuki. The original book follows a group of scientists trying to build a large dome that is meant to protect people in an ensuing atomic war. However, the game instead stars the employee of an advertisement agency who's job is to raise money for the construction of the dome by convincing the populace to donate money towards the project.

The title was developed by System Sacom in June 1988 for various Japanese computers and was the first installment in the company's Novel Ware franchise. While the game is a traditional command-based Japanese adventure game, Dome does not contain any puzzles and instead plays out like a traditional novel with the player able to obtain different endings based on the decisions they make in the story. Dome, and the Novel Ware series in general, is considered the pioneer of novel style video games in Japan and served as an inspiration for both sound novels and eventually visual novels.
results.name: Dome

results.deck: A “legal suspense action” game developed by Sega's Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio, the team behind the Yakuza games, for the PlayStation 4.
results.description:
Overview

Judgment, known in Japan as Judge Eyes: Shinigami no Yuigon, is an investigative action game developed by the Ryu ga Gotoku Studio were the player controls a former defense lawyer turned detective named Takayuki Yagami who is trying to solve the mystery behind a string of recent murders. The game takes place in modern-day Tokyo and features both investigative gameplay, such as collecting clues and following suspects, as well as brawling combat similar to the Yakuza series. Sega published Judgment in Japan on December 13, 2018 with a Western release following the next year on June 25th.

Plot

Set in the same universe as the Yakuza series, the story begins with defense attorney Takayuki Yagami, who managed to win an acquittal on a murder charge for his client Shinpei Okubo in a Japanese justice system where nearly 99% of cases end in some form of conviction for the defendant. However, Yagami's career comes crashing down when Okubo is arrested for stabbing his girlfriend and setting her apartment on fire shortly after being acquitted.

Three years later, in Kamurocho, Yagami makes ends meet, running his own private investigation firm. When the area is rocked by the murders of multiple Yakuza from Kansai, Yagami finds himself dragged into the underworld to find those responsible, as well as the truth behind the incident that destroyed his own reputation.

Gameplay

Similarly to the two prior released Yakuza titles by Ryu ga Gotoku Studios (Kiwami 2 & Yakuza 6) Judgment runs on the Dragon Engine and utilizes the same combat mechanics and physics of said games. The combat plays slightly different, as you are now playing as a slender young detective, who specializes in martial arts type of fighting as opposed to the more brute force based street brawler tactics of Kazuma Kiryu. Yagami's heavy usage of kicks bears resemblance to that of Shun Akiyama, and Goro Majima, and like the latter he has different styles he can switch between.

One called "Crane Style" that emits a blue aura, which is a fighting stance that generally serves as crowd control, to deal with many enemies at once, and another called "Tiger Style" that emits a red aura, this style emphasizes on one-on-one moves. In addition to this, Yagami also has his own arsenal of Heat Actions, called "EX Actions" in this game.

When he is not beating up the local street thugs, he'll find himself having to do some proper detective work. This involves stalking suspects around the streets of Kamurocho, similar to that of Act 3 in Metal Gear Solid 4, and investigating crime scenes in vein of the Batman Arkham Games. Sometimes he'll do this while wearing a disguise too.
results.name: Judgment

results.deck: A reboot of the sword-slashing series of the same name, Samurai Shodown combines an updated 3D cel-shaded style with the series's traditional 2D roots.
results.description:
Overview

Samurai Shodown (known in Japan as Samurai Spirits, and not to be confused with the 1993 game of the same name) is a 2.5D historical-fantasy weapon-based fighting game developed by SNK and published by both SNK (in Japan) and Athlon (worldwide) for the Xbox One and PlayStation 4 on June 25, 2019.

A reboot of the series of the same name, Samurai Shodown is the first mainline entry in the series in 11 years (after Samurai Shodown: Edge of Destiny) and brings the series to its traditional 2D gameplay roots. Along with 13 fighters from previous games in the series (with more added as DLC), the game features three new playable characters: main protagonist Yashamaru, hulking shipwright Darli, and "feng shui" fighter Ruixiang.

The story takes place in 1787 (between the events of Samurai Shodown V and the original Samurai Shodown).

Ports for the Nintendo Switch, PC, and Google Stadia, as well as an arcade release (running PC-based Taito Type X3 hardware with the NESICAxLive2 digital distribution platform), are in development.

Characters

New Additions

  • Yashamaru Kurama - The game's main protagonist. A ronin who stalks the shadows as the phantom thief "Karasu Tengu". Fights with a heirloom nagamaki and ancestral tengu powers.
  • Darli Dagger - A shipwright of African descent who learned how to build from carpenters and how to fight from pirates. Fights with a large saw-tooth blade (which she calls "Libertalia").
  • Wu-Ruixiang - A servant of the Chinese Qing dynasty. Fights with a large luopan and ancestral feng shui powers.
  • Shizuka (final boss) - TBA

Returning Fighters

  • Haohmaru (has a an alternate retro low-poly costume as DLC)
  • Nakoruru (has a an alternate retro low-poly costume as DLC)
  • Genjuro Kibagami (has a an alternate retro low-poly costume as DLC)
  • Yoshitora Tokugawa
  • Ukyo Tachibana
  • Hanzo Hattori
  • Galford
  • Kyoshiro Senryo
  • Jubei Yagyu
  • Tam Tam
  • Charlotte
  • Earthquake
  • Shiki

Post-Release DLC

Season 1 Pass

Also includes the alternate retro Nakoruru costume.

  • Rimururu (returning character, will be added on August 2019)
  • Basara (returning character, will be added on October 2019)
  • Kazuki Kazama (returning character, will be added on December 2019)
  • Wan-fu (returning character, will be added on February 2020)
results.name: Samurai Shodown

results.deck: Project Winter
results.description:
Project Winter is a great 8 person multiplayer survival game where friends betray each other to win the game. The game is all about lying, and convincing others who the two traitors are out of the 8 survivors.

The object of the game as a survivor is to repair objectives, and escape by helicopter, submarine, or a ground vehicle. One person can leave the game early by escaping on the pod, but it leaves the rest of the survivors short handed. No one knows who is a survivor, and who is a traitor. Building trust with other players is the best strategies to successfully accomplishing the goals as a survivor, or traitor.

The role of the two traitors is to get survivors to turn against each other, exile each other, or kill each other so the goals of escaping is unsuccessful. They work together to try to kill the survivors, and prevent them from escaping by either being killed, freeze, or starve to death.

It offers in game voice communications so everyone is able to chat with each other so the deception is very realistic. The traitors start off with walkie talkies so they can communicate with each other no matter where they are, and survivors can't hear. Survivors initially can only talk to each other when in close range until they gather enough materials, and craft a walkie talkie themselves. They can than spy on the traitors by determining their voices, and who they are.

Project Winter enables the ability to craft weapons, food, mines, radios, guns, scraps for repair, first aid kits, and more.
results.name: Project Winter

results.deck: Varnir of the Dragon Star is a world of dragons and witches.
results.name: Varnir of the Dragon Star

results.deck: Puyo Puyo Champions (known as Puyo Puyo eSports in Asia) was created as a realization of Puyo Puyo's status as one of the officially licensed esports in the Japan eSports Union.
results.description:
Puyo Puyo Champions is a competitive-focused entry in the long running Puyo Puyo series. As it is missing nearly all single-player modes besides basic CPU battles, the game's primary focus is promoting competitive Puyo in Japan and the rest of the world.

New features include an offline Tournament mode featuring up to eight human or CPU players battling it out in a single-elimination bracket, a Boost mode that grants various buffs to a player behind in a set, and several quality-of-life features making it easier for spectators to follow the action during a match.

This game marks the first home console appearance of several characters from the smartphone game Puyo Puyo!! Quest, and is the first HD Puyo Puyo game to feature the Fever game mode.

Patch 1.03 introduced single-player challenge modes in which the player is either given an allotted time to obtain as many points as possible or attempts to make it to a specific point value as quickly as possible.
results.name: Puyo Puyo Champions

results.deck: Dōjin underwater exploration action game by FoxEye
results.name: Sacrifice Girl: The Curse of Demon Snake

results.deck: Horror themed adventure game developed by Nihon Falcom for Japanese computers.
results.description:
Overview

Demons Ring is an "Occult Fantasy Adventure" game released in March 1984 where the player solves puzzle by interacting with environments through the use of a text parser. The game is an early title developed by Nihon Falcom and was an example of the company's technical know-how for the time. Every contemporary Japanese adventure game released for computers during this period would draw its graphics line-by-line and slowly fill in the colors, a long process that would need to be done anytime the scene changed to a new image. Demons Ring, on the other hand, could transition to different images in under half a second, a feature that was heavily advertised by Falcom and something that would eventually become a standard for the genre moving forward.
results.name: Demons Ring

results.deck: Farsight Studios brings their Game Party series to Switch with Party Arcade.
results.name: Party Arcade

results.deck: Bubsy inexplicably returns, this time as an "auto-runner" from the studio behind the BIT.TRIP series.
results.description:
Overview

Bubsy: Paws on Fire! is a 2.5D on-rails side-scrolling platformer developed by Choice Provisions and published digitally by BillionSoft (under the the revived "Accolade" brand) for the PlayStation 4 and PC on May 16, 2019. It will be released for the Nintendo Switch on August 29, 2019. The PS4 and Switch versions were also released in retail format.

The sixth game in the Bubsy series of mascot platformers, Paws on Fire! switches the formula by having it as a rhythm-based auto-scrolling platformer (similar to the studio's earlier "Runner" entries in the BIT.TRIP series). It is also the first in the series to have characters from the 1993 Bubsy television pilot (with one of them, inventor Virgil Reality, as a playable character). It is also the first to have one of the series's Woolie antagonists as a playable character.
results.name: Bubsy: Paws on Fire!

results.name: Path to Mnemosyne

results.deck: Prisoners from a stranded ship are sent out to scavenge for resources in this first-person shooter with roguelike elements.
results.description:
Overview

In Void Bastards, a prison ship of 1,000,000 inmates becomes stranded in the Sargasso Nebula with a broken FTL drive. Under the direction of the on-board AI, BACS, prisoners are sent out one by one to scavenge for parts to save the ship. The game is a run-based first person shooter with permadeath and persistent upgrades. Every "run" begins with a prisoner who has a trait assigned to them. These traits can be positive, such as radiation resistance, or negative, such as a bad cough that can alert nearby enemies.

Navigation through the Sargasso Nebula is done using the star map. The star map shows the immediate paths ahead through the nebula, with space ships and wreckage making up nodes on the star map. Traveling to a node consumes 1 Fuel and 1 Food. The player can board any ship to scavenge for supplies, crafting materials, and parts for creating and upgrading equipment. Before boarding, the player can see an overview of some of the supplies the ship has, some of the enemies, called Citizens, that are on board, and traits the ship has. Much like prisoner traits, these traits can also be positive, such as deactivated security, or negative, such as radiation leaks.

There are many types of weapons and gadgets that can be built to engage enemies, either offensively or defensively.

When the player dies, another prisoner is sent out aboard the escape pod to take their place, keeping all of the upgrades and available weapons. However, all resources are lost; instead, prisoners begin with a care package from BACS to get them started.
results.name: Void Bastards

results.deck: Irony Curtain is a satirical point-and-click adventure game set in the Cold War.
results.description:
Overview

Irony Curtain: From Matryoshka with Love is a 2D point and click adventure game developed and published by Artifex Mundi for PC, Mac, and Linux.

System Requirements

PC

PC MinimumPC Recommended
  • Operating System: Windows 7 or newer
  • Processor: 2.5 GHz (Single Core) or 2 GHz (Dual Core)
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 512 MB Video RAM
  • DirectX: Version 9.0b
  • Storage: 3 GB available space

Mac

Mac MinimumMac Recommended
  • Operating System: macOS 10.9
  • Processor: 2.5 GHz (Single Core) or 2 GHz (Dual Core)
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 512 MB Video RAM
  • Storage: 3 GB available space

Linux

Linux MinimumLinux Recommended

results.deck: After a decade, Marvel Ultimate Alliance is back exclusively on Nintendo Switch.
results.description:
Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order is set to have a massive cast of characters including the Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, X-Men, and Ryan Davis' own favorite M.O.D.O.K.

The player will defeat Thanos and The Black Order with up to 4 friends online or in the same room in this long awaited follow-up.

The game will play at the traditional 3/4 view perspective but it is also coming with a zoomed in perspective for players who want to try something new.

DLC has already been announced for the game. It will feature popular franchises like the Fantastic Four, X-Men, and Marvel Knights. They will contain additional characters, modes, and story.

DLC 1 - Fall 2019

DLC 2 - 2019

DLC 3 - 2020
results.name: Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order

results.deck: An upcoming sci-fi RPG from Obsidian Entertainment in the vein of Fallout: New Vegas.
results.description:
The Outer Worlds is a sci-fi RPG developed by Obsidian Entertainment announced at the 2018 Game Awards for the PC, Xbox One, and PS4 in 2019. The game takes place on the last frontier of space, as corporate interests encroach on that frontier. It is pitched as coming from "the original developers" of Fallout and with a style similar to Fallout: New Vegas, another Obsidian-developed RPG.

Originally annouced as coming first to Steam and the Microsoft Store on PC, in March 2019 Obsidian revealed that the game will initally release on the Epic Store and Microsoft Store on PC exclusively for a year before appearing on other PC storefronts. This announcement did not affect the console release plans.
results.name: The Outer Worlds

results.name: Stranger Things 3: The Game

results.deck: Mortal Kombat's eleventh installment involves the time guardian Kronika intending to fix Raiden's mistakes which splintered the timeline.
results.description:
Overview

Mortal Kombat 11 is a 2.5D fighting game developed by NetherRealm and published by WB for the Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, and PC (digitally via Steam) on April 23, 2019.

The eleventh main entry in the Mortal Kombat series, Mortal Kombat 11 further revamps the gameplay of Mortal Kombat X while adding a storyline that combines warriors from both the original and alternate timelines.

Set in the series's alternate timeline shortly after the defeat of Shinnok, the story follows further time manipulation as the Keeper of Time Kronika, displeased with Raiden's actions, causes a temporal anomaly that brings warriors from the original timeline (during the events of Mortal Kombat II) to the new one in order to destroy the alternate Raiden and create a "New Era".

Along with adjustments to the game's super move system (replacing "X-Rays" with one-use "Fatal Blow" attacks), Mortal Kombat 11 builds on the "Variation" system of Mortal Kombat X by allowing players to customize the abilities of each fighter (augmenting or replacing special moves and combos). The game also introduces a new loot-dropping system based on the "Gear System" of Injustice 2, allowing players to earn new outfits, cosmetics, and bonus consumables (for use in single-player modes). Like Injustice 2, the loot system also features microtransactions.

Gameplay

As in previous games, players earn and spend meter for various moves and abilities. Unlike previous entries, MK11 has split its meters into offensive and defensive components. Super moves, called "X-Rays" in previous games, have been replaced with "Fatal Blow" attacks, which can be triggered when a player is at or below 30% health.

Characters can be customized cosmetically as well as from a gameplay perspective, with new moves that can be mapped onto a fighter, replacing or enhancing some of their base moves. Different versions of Sub-Zero, for example, may have his traditional slide or a standing shoulder charge.

The game also features consumable augments that can enhance a character's abilities and stats. Other consumables allow players to summon missiles, meteors, or even other characters for assist attacks. These summons appear to be missing from the multiplayer side of the game, but can be used in the Towers of Time, a rotating list of challenges that are pattern after MKX's Living Towers or Injustice 2's Multiverse. Summons are activated by flicking the right analog stick in a specific direction.

Playable Roster

The base game includes 25 playable characters, one of which was a pre-order bonus (also made DLC) and one of which is unlockable (either by playing through Story Mode or through DLC).

New Additions

  • Cetrion
  • Geras
  • Kollector

Returning Fighters

  • Baraka
  • Cassie Cage
  • D’Vorah
  • Erron Black
  • Frost (unlocked either through Story Mode or purchasing via DLC)
  • Jacqui Briggs
  • Jade
  • Jax
  • Johnny Cage
  • Kabal
  • Kano
  • Kitana
  • Kotal Kahn
  • Kung Lao
  • Liu Kang
  • Noob Saibot
  • Raiden
  • Scorpion
  • Shao Kahn (pre-order bonus, later released as DLC)
  • Skarlet
  • Sonya Blade
  • Sub-Zero

Post-Release DLC

Kombat Pack

  • Shang Tsung (features the voice and likeness of Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, who portrayed him in the 1995 Mortal Kombat film, added on June 25, 2019)
  • Nightwolf (upcoming)
  • Sindel (upcoming)
  • Spawn (guest character from the Spawn series, upcoming)
  • ???
  • ???
results.name: Mortal Kombat 11

results.deck: Shadowbringers is the third expansion to Final Fantasy XIV.
results.description:
Shadowbringer is the latest expansion for the mmorpg Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn.

This expansion brings:

- Maximum level rise from 70 to 80.

- New playable races: Viera (only female) and Hrothgar (only male).

- New playable jobs: Gunbreaker (tank) and Dancer (dps).

- New cities: The Crystarium and Eulmore.
results.name: Final Fantasy XIV: Shadowbringers

results.deck: A fighting game pitting Power Rangers and their villains from across the franchise against each other.
results.description:
Overview

Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid is a sci-fi fighting game developed and digitally published by nWay for the Xbox One and Nintendo Switch on March 26, 2019. It was later released for the PlayStation 4 on April 2, 2019, with a PC release (via Steam) still in development.

Based on the studio's previous adaptation of the Power Rangers series (the 2017 Power Rangers: Legacy Wars), Battle for the Grid is a traditional fighting game with tag-team mechanics similar to the Marvel vs. Capcom series. It also features a unique "Mega Assist" system where players choose one of three characters to assist them from off-screen (Dino Megazord, Dragonzord, or Mega Goldar).

While most of the playable characters are based on the original Mighty Morphin Power Rangers series (and its recent comic book spin-off), the game features characters from different eras of the Power Rangers timeline.

The game is notable for being the first fighting game to have complete cross-platform and cross-progression support with non-Sony platforms.

Characters

The base game includes nine playable characters, with four alternate appearances unlocked as DLC. More characters and alternate variants will be added as DLC (both free and paid).

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (Original)

  • Jason Lee Scott - As the "MMPR Red Ranger". Has an alternate "MMPR Red Ranger w/ Dragon Shield" variant as part of the Season 1 Pass.
  • Tommy Oliver - As the "MMPR Green Ranger". Has an alternate "Green Ranger V2" variant from Power Rangers: Legacy Wars as a pre-order bonus.
  • Goldar

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (Alternate Canon)

  • Lord Drakkon - Has an alternate "EVO II" variant as part of the Digital Collector's Edition.
  • Ranger Slayer - Has an alternate "MMPR Pink Ranger" variant as part of the Digital Collector's Edition.
  • Mastodon Sentry
  • Dragon Armor Trini - Will be added soon as free DLC.

Other Power Rangers Series

  • Magna Defender - From Power Rangers Lost Galaxy.
  • Kat Manx - As the "SPD Kat Ranger" from Power Rangers S.P.D.
  • Gia Moran - As the "SMF Yellow Ranger" from Power Rangers Super Megaforce.
  • Udonna - As the "Mystic White Ranger" from Power Rangers Mystic Force. Will be added soon as free DLC.
  • Cenozoic Blue Ranger - From the 2017 Power Rangers film. Will be added soon as free DLC.

External Links

  • Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid Official Site
results.name: Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid
